intro: Aconitum × berdaui nothosubsp. berdaui, commonly known as the Himalayan monkshood, is a hybrid perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking, hood-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with palmate leaves that are deeply lobed. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is toxic and should be handled with care.
